text: Eduard (Esra) Glass (born 1902 - died after 1980) was an Austrian chess master. He won at Vienna 1927, Name Index to Jeremy Gaige's Chess Tournament Crosstables, An Electronic Edition, Anders Thulin, Malmö, 2004-09-01 and shared 1st with Erich Eliskases at Innsbruck 1929 (Austrian Chess Championship).http://schach.wienerzeitung.at/Welt.aspx?id=177 He played several times in the Trebitsch Memorial in Vienna. Glass represented Austria in the 5th Chess Olympiad at Folkstone 1933.http://www.olimpbase.org/1933/1933id01.html In April 1935, he tied for 3rd-5th in Tel Aviv (the 2nd Maccabiah Games, Abram Blass won).Wolsza, Tadeusz (2007), Arcymistrzowie, mistrzowie, amatorzy. Słownik biograficzny szachistów polskich, tom 5. Wydawnictwo DiG, Warszawa. He tied for 8-10th at Budapest 1936 (Mieczysław Najdorf and Lajos Steiner won). After Anschluss in 1938, he became imprisoned in Dachau concentration camp where he won the camp chess tournament once ahead of Georg Klaus. Later he moved to China, and living in the Shanghai Ghetto survived World War II.http://www.chess.at/geschichte/gesheumo.htm#g27 After the war, Glass participated in the first Israeli Chess Championship in 1951.http://jewishchesshistory.blogspot.com/2018/07/aloni-glass- combination.html There he collected 8 points in 13 games, finishing on rank 3. The winner, Menachem Oren, achieved 9 points:ru:Орен, Менахем.
